trial_identification.studytitle: The absorption of fentanyl from a new wafer in patients who have had major surgery
trial_identification.scientifictitle: The pharmacokinetics and acceptability of a sublingual fentanyl wafer in postoperative patients who have had major gynaecological surgery

interventions.interventions: A single administration of sublingual fentanyl wafer 50 mcg and single administration of intravenous fentanyl 50 mcg, in randomised order, with an 18 hour washout period, after major gynaecological surgery among patients having patient-controlled intavenous morphine
interventions.comparator: A single control administration of intravenous fentanyl 50 mcg, in randomised order with sublingual fentanyl, with an 18 hour washout period, after major gynaecological surgery among patients having patient-controlled intavenous morphine

primaryOutcome.outcome: Drug pharmacokinetics based on fentanyl assay in venous blood using Gas Chromatography Mass Spectrometry (GCMS)
primaryOutcome.timepoint: 2,5,10,30,60,120, and 180 minutes post-administration for each route of administration

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Patient acceptability of wafer assessed by questionnaire and verbal numerical rating score 0-10

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Age 18-70 years Gynaecological surgery Using intravenous morphine patient -controlled analgesia postoperatively
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Oral pathology Intolerance of opioids Pregnancy

trial_design.concealment: Preoperative written consent then allocated using sealed envelope according to cross-over randomization sequence
trial_design.sequence: Latin square randomisation for cross-over sequence

sponsorship.primarysponsorname: King Edward Memorial Hospital for Women

ethicsAndSummary.summary: The pharmacokinetics of a new formulation of fentanyl citrate are being evaluated in postoperative patients
ethicsAndSummary.publication: Lim CB, Paech MJ, Sunderland B, Liu Y. In vitro and in vivo evaluation of a sublingual fentanyl wafer formulation. Drug Res Develop Ther 2013;7:317-24
